column4: i'm trying to install ubuntu on my work pc, but i have no experience with partitioning and i want to install it on a separate partition of my windows disk. anyone have any pointers?
yeah you can use something called the partition magic but that will cost you money
do you have a cd burner?
there are free alternatives
yes, but i have partition magic. the only thing is i don't know how to install ubuntu on it afterwards. i've always chosen autopartition before
i want to be sure i do it right, or else i'll erase ~20 gb of important files :/
I would say first backup your data because I dont like taking risks
then shrink your windows ntfs partition
me neither, but backup is not an option right now, i'm kind of short on money. i've already backuped the most important files
ah ic
yeah it should work pretty well
just shrink your partition and leave the rest empty
and then what do i do in the ubuntu installer?
that's the hard part for me, creating partitions in windows is no problem
when you install ubuntu it will detect the empty partition
you can just install it on there
hold on there is a good video tutorial for this
http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-6104490811311898236&q=
that thing is pretty good
they use the ubuntu dvd as opposed to the cd but that shouldnt matter
skip to around 6 mins
